## [PRIME LIGHTWORKS](http://www.primelightworks.com/</about-us/>)
GREEN HYDROGEN ROCKET LAUNCH
[Learn More](http://www.primelightworks.com/</about-us/>)
# Our Mission
The vision of Prime Lightworks is to help satellite manufacturers and operators achieve zero emissions spaceflight by developing a fully reusable rocket launch vehicle for small satellites using green hydrogen (LH2/LOX) propellant.
[Learn More](http://www.primelightworks.com/<https:/primelightworks.com/about-us/>)

generated_description:
**Prime Lightworks Inc.** is a California-based company headquartered in Culver City that focuses on manufacturing electric propulsion systems specifically designed for space satellites. Their mission? To revolutionize space travel by significantly reducing both costs and waste. Essentially, they’re dreaming big about what’s possible in space tech while staying grounded in sustainability—a critical factor in today's world.

Founded as part of Y Combinator's Batch S16, Prime Lightworks is on a mission to achieve zero emissions for spaceflight. They aim to develop a fully reusable launch vehicle for small satellites, powered by environmentally friendly green hydrogen (using a combination of liquid hydrogen and liquid oxygen propellants). This vision is not just about launching satellites; it's about launching a new era of sustainable space practices.

Despite being a small team with just one employee, they are actively pursuing innovative solutions that align with their values of sustainability, which is evident given their tagging as a 'climate' company. 

You can learn more about their technologies, sustainability efforts, and opportunities to join the team on their website: [Prime Lightworks](http://www.primelightworks.com). They have various sections dedicated to their vision, technology, and updates, which reflects their commitment to transparency and community engagement.

So, Prime Lightworks is not merely another tech startup; it’s a company aiming to illuminate new pathways in the realm of space exploration—all while keeping an eye on our planet’s health. It's a curious blend of ambition and responsibility, making them a noteworthy player in the future of aerospace innovation.
